newsitem.title: CHINA: Each Beijing family owns 775 yuan in stocks.
newsitem.headline: Each Beijing family owns 775 yuan in stocks.

text.p: Each Beijing family holds an average of 775 yuan ($93.37) in shares, the China Securities newspaper said on Tuesday, quoting a survey by the Beijing Statistical Bureau.

At the end of June, 1996, Beijing's 11 million residents held an average of 39,873 yuan worth of financial assets, including 31,660 yuan in bank savings and 4,824 yuan in negotiable securities, the survey showed.
Among the negotiable securities, 3,590 yuan was state debt and 775 yuan was in shares, it said.
Personal investment in negotiable securities was 8.8 times higher compared with the level in 1991 while individual bank savings had increased 7.3 times from 1991, it said .
